reviewText:
This release is similar to "The Movement Of People Working" DVD that was released in the mid 1990s. The images contained on this dvd were filmed around 1984 in Brasil.

It's strange that I am a fan of Niblock's music, when I truly do not like listening to loud music either in concert or in a home environment.

His concerts are "loud" because of the music's reliance on "overtones" which appear as the volume is cranked.

So why do I like the long minimal droney sounds played at either low or medium volume levels? Beats me.
